cves.description: XWiki Remote Macros provides XWiki rendering macros that are useful when migrating content from Confluence. Starting in version 1.0 and prior to version 1.26.5, missing escaping of the classes parameter in the panel macro allows remote code execution for any user who can edit any page The classes parameter is used without escaping in XWiki syntax, thus allowing XWiki syntax injection which enables remote code execution. Version 1.26.5 contains a patch for the issue.
problemType: CWE-95: Improper Neutralization of Directives in Dynamically Evaluated Code ('Eval Injection')

cves.description: A vulnerability was detected in Shanghai Lingdang Information Technology Lingdang CRM up to 8.6.5.4. This affects an unknown function of the file crm/WeiXinApp/dingtalk/index_event.php. The manipulation of the argument corpurl results in server-side request forgery. The attack can be launched remotely. The exploit is now public and may be used. The vendor was contacted early about this disclosure but did not respond in any way.
